text.section: In this section, "Fund" means the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund.
There is a Maryland Veterans Trust Fund in the Department.

section.section: The Fund is a special, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to reversion under § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The State Treasurer shall hold the Fund separately, and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.
The Secretary shall administer the Fund.
The Maryland Veterans Commission, the Maryland Veterans' Home Commission, and program directors shall advise the Secretary on the administration of the Fund.

text.section:
The Fund consists of:
gifts and grants that the Department receives under § 9-912(b) of this subtitle; and
contributions to the Fund from the sale of tickets from instant ticket lottery machines under § 9-112(d) of this title.

Money in the Fund may only be used to:
make grants and loans under § 9-912(b)(2)(i) of this subtitle;
be invested under § 9-912(b)(2)(ii) of this subtitle; and
pay the costs of administering the Fund through distribution to an administrative cost account in the Department.

section.section: The State Treasurer shall invest the money in the Fund in the same manner as other State money may be invested.
Any investment earnings of the Fund shall be credited to the Fund.

text.section: Money expended from the Fund is supplemental to and is not intended to take the place of funding that would otherwise be appropriated to the Department.

section.section: On or before August 31 of each year, the Secretary shall submit a report to the General Assembly, in accordance with § 2-1246 of this article, on the status of the Fund.

The report shall include:
the gross amount of gifts and grants credited to the Fund;
the costs of administration of the Fund; and
a detailed accounting of the use of the Fund.
